description: Five Years Ago This week in 2019, we looked at how the FTC’s settlement with YouTube pissed everyone off and how its settlement with Facebook got everything backwards. Oakland was on its way to becoming the third city to ban facial recognition tech while Orlando police ended their facial recognition deal with Amazon and a […]
title: This Week In Techdirt History: July 21st – 27th

description: I don’t know what the legislative intent of Massachusetts wiretapping law was, but I can’t possibly imagine it was erected solely to allow public employees to get people arrested for filming them performing their public duties in public places. I mean, maybe it was. Maybe that’s the reason the law was enacted. But certainly no […]
title: 1st Circuit: No Immunity For School Officials Who Abused Wiretap Law To Hassle Someone For Recording Them
